sentences.text: Starting boot process.
Checking biometric inputs\and joint integrity.
Hydraulic fluid is at capacity,\reactor is in the green.
MS Scrander, how's it looking\on your end?
The mats printer is running\fine, and I'm not seeing any\errors in our sensor arrays.
Have Hynobius wiggle around\some, though.
Seems that problem with the\joint lockup won't be a pain in\our cornholes today!
We're on record right now,\Scrander.
Aye aye, Pilot Abner.\This old man will be a\consummate professional\from here on out.
Anywho, we ought to be clear\to proceed down the\Gaap Entrance.
Roger.
Put your crash harness on,\Bo.
You're no fun.
End of the road already?
I'm planting my feet, Scrander.\Brace.
Oh boy!
Ah, my heart soars when you\wreck alien biospheres so!
Proceeding.
Now that's queer.
The pile of metal?
Go give it a whack from the\pneumatic driver. I'd like to\take a closer look.
Hmm...
Tungsten nickel iron alloy.
The formation is peculiar, but\it's not far off from what\most of Hynobius is made of.
So we could throw them in\the mats printer in a pinch.
Expecting trouble, Abner?
I wouldn't be pilot for this\mission if I wasn't.
You hear that?
I do.
Let's not listen in too close.
Agreed. Dampening audio eedback.
Good Lordy, look at the size\of these bones!
I've caught bigger.
It's like a titanic Otzi-- except\it looks like something dug\its way here and bit off\everything it could chew.
We can't rule out\decomposition.
I thought about that, but look\closer at the bones.
Do you see it?
Yeah. Dozens of little teeth\marks.
Flash frozen in the ice just to\be a fishy slopsicle!
All the more evidence that\Charybdis is a young moon.
I can only imagine the kind of\upheaval that formed it...
Abner! Look out!
All the signs of a biosphere\were here...
But I didn't think we'd still\have the inhabitants roaming\about...!
I can feel the excitement tingle\in my hemmorhoids!\First contact with life from\another world!
Can you imagine the bio-\diversity?! All these creatures,\cordoned off to this drifting\corner of the universe!
Eyeless predators of the sea!\Plankton-like fungus!\Classification of creatures\beyond human imagination!
...Maria?
Ah. I'm sorry, I didn't think.
Are you alright?
Shaken. I'll get over it in a\second.
Let's keep moving.
This coral is like razor wire.
It must have been predated\on heavily at some point.
Do you reckon it's tasty?
Like stinging nettle! Agitating\barbs, but beneath lies a\delicacy.
Ah, do you think it would\render if I boiled it?
Focus on Hynobius' sensors.
Aye aye, Pilot Abner!
I haven't really asked...
You aren't much of a\question-asker, I am aware.
About your granddaughter.
Ah! Which one do you mean?
I thought you only had the\one.
My daughter is expecting\twins.
Oh.
Congratulations, I guess.
You could try to sound more\excited.
I am, though.
Those two are going to name\one of them after you.
One of my granddaughters.
Why?
I suppose you left an\impression on my daughter.
Though they're spelling it\differently. You know how\Susie is about being her own\original girl.
Oh no.
"Myria."
Ooooh no.
Good motivation to make it\home, don't you think?
I have to stop her before it's\too late.
It's weird, isn't it?
Charybdis' lifeforms, I mean.
They're aliens, so it's to be\expected.
But they aren't alien enough.
Employing the No True\Scotsman fallacy, are you?
I always knew you were a\scoundrel.
Shut up. I mean it's analogous\to life on Earth.
You think it'd be more like\Madagascar with the\environmental isolation.
Especially so with non-\terrestrial life.
But a lot of what we're\seeing down here...
Wouldn't look out of place\back at home.
I've been having the same\thought myself.
It's too early to make any\conclusions, but it might be a\case of evolutionary\pragmatism.
Or maybe it's something\intrinsic to life!
What do you mean?
Perhaps life can only take so\many shapes, so it assumes\those same shapes no matter\where it ends up.
A kind of bio-samsara chaining\a harsh path through the\universe.
It's too early for fatalistic\poetry, MS Scrander.
What can I say? I'm an artist\before I'm a scientist.
A young person like you\should be bursting with energy\out on this new frontier!
Did the ride here tucker you\out?
What I'm tuckered of is eating\freeze dried beef-a-roni.
It's not all that bad.
If you close your eyes, the\noodles are like dusty pork\rinds.
I don't want to vomit in low\gravity conditions.
Fine, fine.
GOOD HEAVENS! THE\DIFFERENCE IN PRESSURE IS\PULLING US IN! AIEEEEEEE!
Seems we're out of the reef.
I wonder why?
Were you starting to get\comfortable?
Watching you twitch at every\corner, perhaps.
Hmph.
Still, it seems arbitrary. This\coral functions without\sunlight.
The temperature difference at\this depth is insignificant.
Microbial life should continue to thrive as it did in the layer above.
And if it was the pressure,\the Hynobius would be\impacted significantly.
Yet here we are, still in\optimal performance range.
The reef is a fence.
We're being told to stay out.
Quite the assumption,\Pilot Abner.
No more absurd than your\own.
Haha! True, true. Still, say it is\a kind of intentional barrier...
That just gets me more\excited to see what's being\hidden down here.
I don't like this, Scrander.
I don't either. Let's get a basic\idea of this layer's structure\then head back.
Aye aye.
I think we're through the\worst of the coral.
The radar looks clear going\forward. I'd be inclined to\agree.
Still, I can't shake the feeling\that something's off about\this layer.
Not to mention that we're\approaching the Hynobius' hull\crush depth.
At this pressure our sensors would've been impacted\significantly.
Yet here we are, still in\optimal performance range.
The reef is a fence.
We're being told to stay out.
Quite the assumption,\Pilot Abner.
No more absurd than your\own.
Haha! True, true. Still, say it is\a kind of intentional barrier...
That just gets me more\excited to see what's being\hidden further below.
I don't like this, Scrander.
I don't either. Let's get a basic\idea of this next region's\structure then head back.
Aye aye.
Strange... There's some kind\of atypical electromagnetic\activity down here.
Will it impact performance?
With the shielding over the\Hynobius' electronic systems,\it shouldn't be a problem\at all.
To be expected of the\vanguard unit for the Europan\expeditions.
We might as well be\untouchable in that regard!
Don't jinx it, MS Scrander.\There's already been too\many surprises on this\mission.
He's not... He's not back\there.
Shit. Shit shit shit.
He wouldn't be harebrained\enough to take off into the\waters. So where did he...?
...The waste ejection closet,\maybe?
Damn it.
What the hell is going on?
Out in the waters then. He's got to be out there, I can't\think of anything else.
We've rebooted.
Damage report is coming\through. The hull is fine, but\Hynobius' sensors are...
...This can't be right. These\readings place us miles below\our maximum depth rating.
Something must have been\damaged in the fall, but I'm\not seeing any warnings for\instrument failure.
How would you explain it,\Scrander?
He's not... He's not back\there.
Shit. Shit shit shit.
He wouldn't be harebrained\enough to take off into the\waters. So where did he...?
...The waste ejection closet,\maybe?
Damn it.
What the hell is going on?
Out in the waters, then. He's got to be out there. I can't\think of anything else.
Holy SHIT!
Too close.
Those things... If they can phase through matter, did one of them get Bo?
No, I can't think like that yet.
They're right in my damn way back. But they aren't pursuing any longer...
It shouldn't be that much\deeper. There might be a\tunnel back if I just keep\moving.
The pneumatic driver should\be able to get through the\surface ice if I keep striking it.
Damn it, Scrander.
You better be alive. What am I supposed to tell your family otherwise?
Th-that's not possible. No. No way.
A hallucination! That's it, a\stress hallucination. I'm just\finally losing my cool!
That's why this looks like\home! There's no place like\home, right? Except there's no\fucking ruby slippers!!!
Where the hell are you, Bo?!?
This has to be a nightmare
Another amphibious mech.
We should be the first ones\here.
The joints are ruined...\It's a sitting duck.
Maybe the Empirians beat us\here?
Doesn't look like their colors,\though.
Whoever they are, they're\hailing us through comms.
This is Pilot Maria Abner of\the Federation of Autonomous\States Space Force.
Who is commanding that\machine?
You two again.
How many times will I be made to watch this farce?
You can't even understand my words.
Yet I must\continue to\try.
What?
The translation software is\tying itelf in a knot, Abner.
I can't make heads or tails of\it.
Turn back.
If you will not\turn back, then\abandon hope\of escape.
It will be less\cruel that way.
There is no\above to this\below.
It is simply\an echo of what\will come to\pass.
I can't understand you, sir.
Damn it. He closed the\transmission.
He's not picking back up\either. Nothing more we can\do.
Are you saying we should just leave him here?
We can't retrive that machine\without support from the\surface team.
Even if we did get their\support, we'd need approval\from planetside to begin\retrieval.
Would we even have the\time?
The integrity of that machine's\life support systems is fine\from what can be observed\on sensors.
And that pilot isn't sending a\distress signal.
So yes. Though that's a\pending answer.
...We'll be back for you,\whoever you are.
However long that might take.
